objective:
線性電路；電算放大器；二極體；非線性電路應用；接面場
效電晶體（JFET）；金屬氧化物半導體場效電晶體 (MOSFET)
；雙極性接面電晶體（BJT）；差動放大器；多級放大器。金
氧半電晶體；雙接面電晶體；差動及多極放大器；功率放大

Course Title:Electronics and Electronics Lab.
Description:The properties of semiconductor and fabrication of a PN
diode and BJT, and their characteristics are explained. Part 2
concentrates on analog circuit and system. Method of biasing a
discrete BJT or EET are given, and stability of the operating point is
discussed. The small-signal model for each device is abstained and used
to calculate the performance of low frequency single stage and
cascaded amplifiers. The feedback concepts of AMP. OP AMP, its
characteristics and applications are described.
schedule:
Week 1-2: Circuit Analysis Fundamentals
Introduction to current, voltage, and resistance
Ohm's law
Kirchhoff's voltage and current laws
Circuit analysis techniques for series and parallel circuits

Week 3-4: Diode Components and Circuits
Introduction to diodes and their basic principles
PN junction and diode I-V characteristics
Diode applications (rectifiers, amplifiers, switches)

Week 5-6: BJT Circuits
Introduction to Bipolar Junction Transistors (BJTs)
BJT operation principles and I-V characteristics
BJT amplifier circuits (common emitter, common collector, common base)

Week 7-8: FET Components and Circuits
Introduction to Field-Effect Transistors (FETs)
FET operation principles and I-V characteristics
FET amplifier circuits (common source, common drain, common gate)

Week 9: Midterm exam

Week 10: Current Mirrors
Principles and applications of current mirrors
Stability and current distribution in current mirrors

Week 11-12: Integrated Single-Stage Amplifiers
Basic principles and structures of integrated single-stage amplifiers
Common integrated single-stage amplifier circuits

Week 13-14: Differential Amplifiers
Principles and structures of differential amplifiers
Common-mode rejection and differential gain in differential amplifiers

Week 15-16: Power Amplifiers
Basic concepts and classifications of power amplifiers
Common power amplifier circuits (Class A, Class B, Class AB)

Week 17: Frequency Response Basics, Amplifier Frequency Response, and Feedback Amplifiers
Introduction to frequency response and analysis techniques
Frequency response analysis and design of amplifiers
Introduction to feedback amplifiers and their types, stability

Week 18: Final Exam
